sub_title: Ph.D. Theory and Methodology of Professional Education | Quality Manager | Coordinator | Lecturer
summary:
My experience in the field of education for more than 6 years and a Ph.D. "Theory and Methodology of Higher Professional Education", unleashed my potential in academic management and teaching skills in various educational institutions. My core competencies as an educator include the development and implementation of curricula, psycho-pedagogical diagnostics, teaching various subjects, coordination of scientific activities, and cultural integration. I am passionate about creating a supportive and exciting learning process and adapting students to a new environment. My commitment to continuous learning and professional development allows me to explore new opportunities and not stand still.

As an Assistant Event Coordinator, I have the experience of coordinating 20 volunteers who have carried out activities aimed at educating and integrating expats in a new country. As well as the experience of attracting new 7 volunteers, information support for our event participants, and publication of information in social networks of the company.

As a Class Teacher at Hermann Wesselink College, I had the privilege of working with children who fled from Ukraine and helped them adapt to a new country and culture. I taught Math and Socio-Emotional Learning in English and collaborated with my colleagues and parents to provide holistic and personalized education and student support. It was very intense, but I really enjoy this job!

As a volunteer working with refugees, I have worked in a fast-paced environment and have been helped by my multitasking skills. Collaboration with the municipality of Amstelveen, colleagues, and community partners has made it possible to provide comprehensive and individual support to refugees.

The Quality Management System is also a field of my professional expertise, which is confirmed by my work background and a Certification of quality management systems based on ISO 9000 standards. I have an in-depth understanding of developing quality management system documentation, conducting internal audits, analyzing and processing data, and writing reports.

As a great teammate, my ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a positive approach makes me a great addition to any professional team. I consider initiative and attention to detail as my strengths, as well as strong communication skills while multitasking. A high level of computer literacy and easy learning ability help me to solve work tasks quickly.

profile_positions.description:
Class teacher of the transitional class (Ukrainian Crossover Class) with children around 11-12 years old, Ukrainian refugees: 
- Curriculum development and selection of materials.
- Acted as a link between the administration of college, management, and parents.
- Took an active part in meetings of representatives of the teachers and administrative staff to improve the educational process of children.
- Teaching Math in English (6 hours per week). 
- Use of various modern applications and programs in the learning process (Kahoot, Khan Academy, lessonUp, Wordwall).
- Teaching Art and Craft (in English).
- Dutch, English, and Drama teacher's assistant.
- Teaching Socio-Emotional Learning (in English).
- Social and psychological support of students (conducting games for class rallying and team building, prevention and resolution of conflicts, creation of a friendly atmosphere in the classroom).
 - Information support for parents.
 - Preparing and holding parent meetings.
 - Assistance as an interpreter for parents.
 - Conducting tests to analyze student progress.
 - Compiling reports and characteristics for each student.
 - Continuous entry of data about students and their progress into the Magister program.
 - Organization and holding of extracurricular activities (Easter, New Year, etc.).
 - Assistance in adapting children to new educational conditions (conducting board games with students from other classes).
 - Accompanying students in extracurricular activities (National Ballet, Cheese Farm, etc.)
 - Support for children in their further distribution between educational institutions.
Ukrainian Crossover Class is part of Hermann Wesselink College (VO, secondary school).
profile_positions.title: Class Teacher

profile_positions.description:
I worked for Stichting Connect International, now IWCN.

- Coordinating the work of the 20 volunteers who host hobby clubs for expats, such as Book club, Meditation, Running club, etc.
- Supporting hobby clubs to meet the needs of these communities, their members, and volunteers.
- Analyzing the interests of members for creating new events.
- Developing the number of clubs and recruiting new volunteers (recruited 7 new volunteers).
- Assisting leaders and colleagues in planning, organizing, and conducting events. 
- Supporting and compiling information for event plans, liaising with venues such as cafes and universities. 
- Creating flyers for events and for social media (using the program Canva).
- Direct hosting of events (such as Open Day, Pub Night, Coffee Morning, Sunday Brunch, etc.).
- Communicating with members and volunteers via email, and responding to emails.
- Publishing: implementing a communications and social media strategy by publishing timely information on all of the company's social media channels, including Instagram and Facebook Feeds and Stories.
- Content Creation.
- Searching and preparing material for the Weekly Newsletter.
- Adding and publishing a schedule of events and hobby clubs on the company website.

*January 2017 - October 2017 - moving to the Netherlands and labor market orientation

volunteer_experiences.role: Participant of the Amstelveen Connect@ project
volunteer_experiences.description:
Amstelveen has become an increasingly diverse and vibrant city in recent years, as 46% of its residents are migrants and 21% have a foreign passport. Living together in such a diverse context is not always easy. It is therefore important that people from different backgrounds come into contact with each other. 

Many organisations, companies and associations are already working in this direction. In Amstelveen, there are wonderful initiatives to make people get to know each other better and gain a deeper understanding of cultural similarities and differences by cooking together, playing sports, making music, etc.      

Sometimes it is difficult for people with different backgrounds to meet and sometimes they need help organising activities. By creating centres of communication, even bigger initiatives are being created to involve more people. This is why the municipality has launched the Amstelveen Connect@ project, a networking platform that brings together both events and those who organise them.

Assisting refugees from Ukraine in Amstelveen and Amsterdam:
- Helping as an interpreter in hotels where refugees from Ukraine were staying and in the municipality of Amstelveen
- Looking for and coordinating volunteers
- Informational support for refugees from Ukraine in social networks and on WhatsApp
- Collecting information about the needs of refugees and delivering needed items to the hotels 
- Collecting and sorting things in the warehouse for refugees
- Helping to organize sports games for children from Ukraine
Support and organization of summer activities for a group of children 5-6 years old
